edu.upenn.cis.ppod.security
Class AccessInterceptor

java.lang.Object
  org.hibernate.EmptyInterceptor
      edu.upenn.cis.ppod.thirdparty.ChainedInterceptor
          edu.upenn.cis.ppod.security.AccessInterceptor
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable, org.hibernate.Interceptor
public final class AccessInterceptor
extends ChainedInterceptor
implements org.hibernate.Interceptor

Hibernate interceptor that implements CRUD access control via Apache Shiro. N.B., This is not a typical Interceptor implementation, don't use this as a model.

See Also:

                            Object[] currentState,
                            Object[] previousState,
                            String[] propertyNames,
                            org.hibernate.type.Type[] types)
                     throws org.hibernate.CallbackException
Method called when an object is detected to be dirty, during a flush. This method is called by "modify" actions.

Specified by:
onFlushDirty in interface org.hibernate.Interceptor
Overrides:
onFlushDirty in class ChainedInterceptor
Parameters:
entity - object to be updated in the database.
id - the identifier of the instance.
currentState - array of property values.
previousState - cached array of property values.
propertyNames - array of property names.
types - array of property types.
Returns:
true if the currentState was modified in any way.
Throws:
org.hibernate.CallbackException - if a problem occured.

onLoad

public boolean onLoad(Object entity,
                      Serializable id,
                      Object[] state,
                      String[] propertyNames,
                      org.hibernate.type.Type[] types)
               throws org.hibernate.CallbackException
Method called just before an object is initialized. This method is called by "load" actions and queries, but there does not seem to be a way to distinguish between these cases.

Specified by:
onLoad in interface org.hibernate.Interceptor
Overrides:
onLoad in class ChainedInterceptor
Parameters:
entity - uninitialized instance of the class to be loaded
id - the identifier of the new instance.
state - array of property values.
propertyNames - array of property names.
types - array of property types.
Returns:
true if the state was modified in any way.
Throws:
org.hibernate.CallbackException - if a problem occured.
See Also:
net.sf.hibernate.Interceptor#onLoad(java.lang.Object, java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Object[], java.lang.String[], net.sf.hibernate.type.Type[])
